name: Meriton Grand Conference & Spa Hotel

reviews.text: I visited Tallinn with four friends in early November. We got a great rate for three rooms. The hotel's location is terrific as it is just a short walk to beautiful and historic Old Town. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Here is a list of my pros and cons.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Close to Old Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time to stay in the hotel for new year time. From the previous time the difference was that the price had gone up by 50% and that didn't even cover all... Small things like bathrobes - you had to pay more! Last year everything was great - price reasonable, room with great view on the old town fortress, nice experience in spa etc. This year things were so different - while asking for a room here for the new year time, they gave us several prices - 150 eur, 135 eur, finally around 100 eur/room through a local friend. The pricing through e-mail enquiry was higher than in their website! When phoned, they said that the party packs that are advertised in their website were only for Russians!! That price was less than 70 eur!! This is unbelievable, as we were not in Russia, but in Estonia! Also spa packs were not available, although their website doesn't mention anything about the non-available times. First we got a room in the old side ("first part"), the room was old and tables were not wiped well. The next night we changed to the new side, with much nicer room interior (but also there was something wrong - the light system was strange, you couldn't use the night lights easily). The old part is definitely not four star, so when booking, immediately ask for the new part room, to avoid paying a lot for poor room!!
reviews.title: Discriminating, multi-pricing hotel!! just an average experience!

reviews.text: Spa was just ok, they had changed infrared sauna to a stupid mild sauna, salt and steam sauna is nice. Also check whether you get full-day access to spa or not, that is also varying - sometimes just until 11am??
reviews.title: Much nearer the sights than you think

reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was just ok, the other morning too full of people and lack of food...
reviews.title: Good Hotel Great Spa

reviews.text: And finally, they made a mistake in our mini-bar charge.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, fair prices

reviews.text: So, a good deal if you are Russian, if other nationality, you are certainly charged more!!!
reviews.title: A very friendly hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Meriton Grand was a fantastic choice for my partner and I. We like to stay close to the action and we only had a 5 - 10 min walk into the old town along a busy road so its fine for walking to and from hotel late at night. If location is key to your hotel choice then this is a very good option.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location & Amazing Spa Facilities...oh & Cakes

reviews.text: The Spa was amazing, best I have ever come across in a hotel so far. Lots of reviews said that access to the pool / sauna etc was only free for guests from 0700 - 1100 but this is not true at all. We had free access to all facilities from 0700 - 2200. There are 2 pools both at different tempratures, 2 jacuzzis, again one hotter than the other. Space for kids to play, bubble beds and waterfalls. There is a salt sauna, an aromatherapy sauna and a female / male only sauna. There is also a really nice steam room. Massages and spa treatments come at an extra cost.
reviews.title: Great service, great spa and great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast if fine, the usual, cereal, bacon, eggs, pancakes, jams etc. The cake shop is a must try - great variety of cakes. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants as Tallinn has many wonderful rastaurants to try.
reviews.title: Fab

reviews.text: We had a modern room which wasn't long renovated. It was very clean and tidy but nothing special, same standard of a good Premier Inn, Ibis or Novotel. If you are in the hotel you'll be spending time in the Spa anyway as opposed to the bedroom! :-)
reviews.title: Nice Spa area at the Meriton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Whole hotel has free wifi as do most cafes / restaurant / pubs in Tallinn.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and were impressed by how trendy and clean this spa hotel was. The general atmosphere of this new hotel was good.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, quiet hotel but location and service not optimal

reviews.text: The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and very quiet. You could not hear any noise from the other rooms or the street. On the minus side, the rooms are quite small.
reviews.title: Super SPA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a big spa with several different pools, jaccuzzis and saunas that is free of charge for the hotel guests (depending on the package you paid for). It's really relaxing and one of the best things in the hotel. They have an aromatic sauna, steam bath, normal sauna and salt sauna. For an extra charge you can also try the infrared sauna. The gym has all the basic equipment and is included in the room fee.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay very close to the old town.

reviews.text: The hotel has several bars and restaurants. Especially the café in the hotel is great. They bake their own delicious cakes and rolls that are sold for half the price between 9 pm and 10 pm.
reviews.title: A good hotel to stay and enjoy spa life

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beauty salon is the best thing in the whole hotel. The staff is very professional and the treatments are extremely good!
reviews.title: A decent spa hotel with contras
